name: Vegetarian Pad Thai Vegetables
description: This vegetarian pad Thai vegetables can be customized with your favorite veggies. Feel free to add some plant-free tofu too! Perfect for vegans and family-friendly.

recipeInstructions.text: Soak and drain dry rice noodles according to package labeling.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak and drain dry rice noodles according to package labeling.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Sauté shallots, garlic, and sweet preserved radish until fragrant, about a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Sauté shallots, garlic, and sweet preserved radish until fragrant, about a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the palm sugar until it’s fully dissolved and starts to caramelize.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the palm sugar until it’s fully dissolved and starts to caramelize.

recipeInstructions.text: Add your stir-fry sauces; tamarind paste, light soy sauce, and water. Mix well before continuing.
recipeInstructions.name: Add your stir-fry sauces; tamarind paste, light soy sauce, and water. Mix well before continuing.

recipeInstructions.text: Add your pre-soaked rice noodles and stir-fry them until they’re soft yet chewy and well-coated with the sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Add your pre-soaked rice noodles and stir-fry them until they’re soft yet chewy and well-coated with the sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Add carrots and cook until they’re softened to your liking. Then, turn off the heat and gently stir in the bean sprouts and garlic chives to retain their crunch. Serve immediately. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Add carrots and cook until they’re softened to your liking. Then, turn off the heat and gently stir in the bean sprouts and garlic chives to retain their crunch. Serve immediately. Enjoy!

keywords: noodles with vegetables, pad thai vegetables, vegetarian noodles, vegetarian pad thai
